column1: BARBARIAN
In the past
column2: most barbarians lived in tribes. These tribes were nomadic
column3: so they constantly traveled from place to place. They followed the animals that they hunted and maintained close relationships with the gods. They built up large camps that were made out of simple shelters and animal hides. Each tribe had a strong sense of community and family.

column1: Over time
column2: as civilization encroached
column3: the tribes gradually merged with it. If the tribe was strong
column4: it was often absorbed into the new culture. Sometimes the tribe was allowed to maintain its culture as a special group within the civilization. Most of the time
column5: however
column6: they were driven out to the fringes of civilization or the wilderness.

column1: After surviving for so long as a separate and unique culture
column2: the barbarians still look at themselves as different and superior to others. They have a strong sense of honor
column3: and they are fiercely loyal to their friends. Barbarians are generally at peace with most races. They get along well with most groups with traditional warrior cultures. Barbarians generally hate those who they think have abandoned the warrior lifestyle and turned into cowards.

column1: For as long as war has raged
column2: heroes from every race have aimed to master the art of battle. Barbarians combine strength
column3: leadership
column4: and a vast knowledge of arms and armor to wreak havoc in glorious combat. Some protect from the front lines with shields
column5: locking down enemies while allies support the warrior from behind with spell and bow. Others forgo the shield and unleash their rage at the closest threat with a variety of deadly weapons. The barbarian's battle cries embolden friends and leave foes cowering in fear. With legendary precision
column6: warriors target the smallest gaps in armor and slice at hamstrings in a blur of steel.

column1: The pronounced muscles of his broad shoulders and back ripple with the simple action of brushing a whetstone along the blade of his greataxe. He wears no armor
column2: a practice that has resulted in many scars from what must have been dozens of battles. He lifts his head from his task
column3: turning it slightly to reveal a tusked mouth and heavy brow. The half-orc knows you're looking.

column1: When she was young
column2: her parents were killed by a band of orcs in the night. She was able to escape with an older woman and two boys. She grew up on the streets of the land
column3: learning the hard way. Still
column4: she was able to learn much about the world. She grew up a fighter
column5: always proving her own toughness. She learned how to read and write along the way
column6: but she was never really interested in it. It was really just a means to communicate with others. While working as a barmaid
column7: she was impressed by the gold and gems that the lord of the castle wore around his neck and on his fingers. She wanted to find a way to gather her own fortunes and riches. Her childhood friends persuaded her to leave the bar and become a hired sword to make a way for her future.

column1: While he was still a young boy
column2: he attended the prestigious school at kingdom. At school
column3: he developed a love for drinking and fighting
column4: which he would work on for the rest of his life. He joined an elite fighting squad that served the duke of the land
column5: helping to protect the duke's lands. When he was a young man
column6: he challenged the king to a fight. The duke won
column7: and he was exiled from kingdom. He traveled to the vast grasslands of the plains
column8: where he practiced his fighting skills and drank his fill.

column1: Left alone in the world with no one to guide him
column2: he became a recluse
column3: ashamed of his lack of direction. He lived in fear of the outside world and sought solace only in his books. He devoted himself to learning more about the world
column4: and of the glory of man. He dreamed of becoming a hero to those around him
column5: and felt that he could do this by mastering the magical arts. With that in mind
column6: he set off on his journey.

column1: A female barbarian striking down with her blade.However
column2: barbarians were united - no matter their origins - by a marked lack of discipline or patience for the laws and traditions that others adhered to. Likewise
column3: while a generalization
column4: it is true to some degree that nearly all barbarians came from outside the confines of settled civilization
column5: being far more common among nomadic tribes or frontier settlers than they were among urban city dwellers. It is from these remote origins that barbarians often derived their reverence for nature
column6: which brought them closer to druids
column7: rangers
column8: and others who venerated the wilderness.

column1: Many barbarians were human
column2: since humans were among the most widespread of the races
column3: as well as in many cases
column4: the most uncivilized. However
column5: orc and goblinoid barbarians were more common still and were sometimes the most commonly encountered warriors of their race. Barbarians from other races were relatively rare
column6: though among elves there were the wild elves
column7: among halflings the ghostwise
column8: and among dwarves the wild dwarves
column9: each of which possessed barbarian traditions.

column1: Barbarians' bravery and wanderlust made them uncommonly suited for the adventuring lifestyle. Often coming from nomadic tribes
column2: most barbarians had few qualms with the traveling life typical to adventuring parties. Of the difficulties suffered by barbarians in adapting to a life of adventure
column3: the greatest was most commonly the loss of family structure that comes from leaving the tribe. With time
column4: however
column5: many barbarians found the bonds with their new companions a worthy substitute.

column1: Barbarians held varying attitudes towards magic. On the one hand
column2: barbarians distrusted most things they did not understand and this extended towards what they called book magic or magic learned in a school or university
column3: such as that used by swordmages or wizards.  On the other hand
column4: barbarians were themselves wielders of primal magic
column5: as were the druids many barbarians called friends or allies. Likewise
column6: barbarians often showed a large degree of respect for sorcerers
column7: whose approach to magic was similar to their own unbridled style of combat. In no small way
column8: it was likely that the barbarian prejudice against scholarly magic was due in some part to the fact that many barbarians were illiterate.

column1: A group of dragonborn barbarians. As handy with a weapon as a fighter
column2: barbarians became tougher and more agile as they grew more powerful. The most experienced barbarians were almost incomparably powerful
column3: with a strength and constitution well beyond that of most mortals.  Though barbarians often used one-handed weapons
column4: many preferred to use two-handed weapons in order to deal more damage to their foes. Barbarians were also well-versed in the use of light armor
column5: and many lacked training in heavier forms of protection such as chain shirts or shields
column6: while very few were trained in and most lacked training in heavy armor
column7: such as plate mail.

column1: Because most of them were untrained in the use of heavy armor
column2: barbarians trained themselves to take incredible amounts of punishment that could easily fell less sturdy warriors. Additionally
column3: most barbarians were capable of moving much more quickly while wearing half plate or lighter armor
column4: by a factor of between thirty and forty percent. Another boon to barbarians' feral and exposed style of attack was their aptitude for quickly following up one attack with another immediately thereafter
column5: overwhelming their enemies until they were able to deal fatal blow. This
column6: along with their instinctive sense for danger
column7: which made them nigh impossible to flank effectively or put off guard
column8: made barbarians far more formidable than their lightly armored appearance would suppose.

column1: Many barbarians drew upon the primal energies of the natural world and its guardian spirits
column2: often in the form of ancestral totems
column3: for empowerment
column4: gaining powerful abilities called evocations.  The feral might gained by barbarians could manifest in many other ways and some used it to empower themselves to the point of nigh invulnerability
column5: finding it easier to take blows and plow onward rather than dodge them. Others gained the ability to literally shape their fate
column6: affecting the quality of luck dealt them through force of will.

column1: The most distinctive aspect of barbarians was their ability to rage
column2: wherein they let loose powerful emotional bursts fueled by their primal power or inner fury.  When they raged
column3: barbarians gained a number of powerful benefits
column4: including an increase in physical prowess
column5: and greater insensitivity to many forms of physical damage. This rage usually lasted about a minute
column6: but with experience and training
column7: most barbarians could extend it indefinitely.

column1: Barbarians also were known to take on other
column2: less common abilities. While raging
column3: barbarians were typically unable to cast evocations
column4: spells
column5: or other similar abilities. Some barbarians were more skilled with lesser evocations whilst raging. Barbarians could also use a fraction of their raging power to deal a devastating attack known as a rage strike.

column1: Barbarians came in a number of different varieties
column2: with a number of diverse capabilities. Two of the main divergent branches of barbarians were the path of the berserker and the path of the totem warrior.

column1: Where some barbarians drew upon the essence of nature and primal magic for their power
column2: barbarians on the path of the Berserker instead relied on their own fury and unbridled bloodlust to pull them through a fight. As a result
column3: berserkers relied less extensively on primal magic and instead focused on improving their rage ability. When a berserker raged they could enter into an even deeper state of primal fury known as a frenzy. While frenzied
column4: a berserker was capable of attacking more quickly
column5: although such effort eventually tired them out. Raging berserkers were also utterly fearless and immune to the effects of charms.

column1: In addition to utilizing their rage in a way far greater than other barbarians
column2: berserkers were also much more frightening to behold. Sufficiently powerful berserkers could actually cause their enemies to run in terror from them through their presence alone. Experienced berserkers also maintained exceptionally good battle reflexes
column3: allowing them to strike a retaliatory blow to anyone who injured them in a fight.

column1: Barbarians with a more spiritual side pursued the path of the Totem Warrior
column2: a calling which enhanced the barbarians' capacity for primal magic and forging a strong connection between them and their spirit animal. The spirit animal chosen by Totem Warriors - which was often related to their particular tribal culture - granted them a number of supernatural abilities
column3: such as the ability to carry extra weight
column4: enhance the ability of their allies in battle
column5: or even fly a limited distance in short bursts. Additionally
column6: Totem Warriors also sometimes took on physical features similar to their spirit animal
column7: such as excess hair or unusually colored eyes.

column1: All Barbarians have a certain immunity to magic bound within them as a result of so much exposure to the powerful forces. Training in brute strength and physical force was the norm for Barbarians
column2: with great endurance and vitality being praised. They came to be large people
column3: with flaring tempers which makes the blood of a Barbarian truly boil when he is outraged. Chief weapon to the Barbarians was the axe
column4: for it was this weapon that proved most useful to them in the forests and jungles where they resided. Their great strength allows them to wield other weapons in a single hand
column5: but the axe is still the weapon of choice for most Barbarians.

column1: From the shattered lands of the Medieville this proud race of people hails. A tribal and nomadic culture
column2: the southern Barbarians prayed to no deity and swore allegiance to no leader. This was the reason that when the kingdoms of the Stormy Pier invaded the Barbarian lands
column3: little resistance was found. The scattered villages fought valiantly
column4: each man
column5: woman and child battling to the death against the hordes of magic users from the distant lands
column6: but to no avail. The lands of the Barbarians
column7: beautiful forests and the majestic jungles
column9: and the tribes scattered to the four winds. Still proud
column11: but they are small in number. They despised all magic
column12: for it was this mystical force that was used against them in the wars they had fought. Their battles in the war taught them much about magic however. Because of the war against the wizards

column1: The extended periods of time that most Barbarians spend away from their homes and civilization requires that they learn to repair their own weapons and armor
column2: although their skill is no match for the talent of a true blacksmith

column1: For ages
column2: the Barbarians were shaped to be as strong and unyielding as stone. Immense in size and unmatched in ferocity
column3: they were charged from birth with a duty passed through generations: to protect the world. They became aimless
column4: haunted by their past
column5: traveling from place to place without honor or direction.

column1: Wild and bloodthirsty berserkers lurk on the fringes of civilisation

column3: these savages are beyond counting and only kept at bay by the stout shields of soldiers & their fear of the bright lights of the cities.

column1: People of towns and cities take pride in how their civilized ways set them apart from animals

column3: though

column6: primal physicality
column7: and ferocious rage. Barbarians are uncomfortable when hedged in by walls and crowds. They thrive in the wilds of their homelands: the tundra
column9: or grasslands where their tribes live and hunt.

column1: DWARF
The dwarves of Frozen Empire spent countless generations mining treasures from deep within the earth. Hidden within their impregnable stronghold of frozen mountains
column2: they rarely ventured beyond the wintry peaks of the rest of the world. Recently however
column3: the dwarves unearthed a series of ruins that held secrets to their ancient heritage. Driven to discover the truth about his people's fabled origins
column4: the great King ordered that the dwarves shift their industry from mining to archaeology. As part of the alliance
column5: the stoneward dwarven armies have been called away to battle the merciless Horde in faraway lands. In these perilous times
column6: the defense of the mountain kingdom falls to brave dwarves like you. The spirits of the ancient kings watch over you
column7: and the very mountains are your strength. The future of your people is in your hands.

column1: In ages past
column2: the dwarves cared only for riches taken from the earth's depths. Then records surfaced of a god-like race said to have given the dwarves life and an enchanted birthright. Driven to learn more
column3: the dwarves devoted themselves to the pursuit of lost artifacts and ancient knowledge. Today dwarven archaeologists are scattered throughout the globe. Bold and adventurous
column4: the dwarves of Frozen Empire are a hardy people who relish battle and exploration. Recently
column5: records surfaced of a god-like race said to have given the dwarves life

column20: the future of Frozen Empire falls to brave dwarves like you.The dwarves of Frozen Empire are an ancient race of robust humanoids who live beneath the snow-capped mountains of Frozen Empire. These dwarves have always been fast allies to the humans and they revel in the prospects of battle and storytelling alike.

column1: Dwarves start out in their snowy homeland
column2: specifically in Frozen Empire. Their capital city is the ice fortress of the mountains
column3: which is where the council of dwarves rules over their united clans. The mount of choice for this stout folk is the ram. Whilst dwarves speak the common tongue of their human friends
column4: their racial language is dwarven. As of the latest expansion
column5: dwarf characters can select from every class except druid and demon hunter
column6: a versatility matched only by trolls.

column1: Dwarves' mountains were devastated during the war and their population slowly diminished during the Ice Age due to dwindling resources and predation by yetis. They survived past the Ice Age and now they reside in Frozen Empire.
These dwarves lived in the Dwarven household in the Frozen Empire. When the climate cooled and the goblins and orcs migrated away from their ancestral lands
column2: the empire of the dwarves was the first to fall before their onslaught. In the legend of The Lady of the Frozen Empire
column3: it is believed that a remaining few summoned the Lady and she teleported them away. It is believed by modern dwarves that they will return to save dwarvenkind from great peril.

column1: Dwarves lived in the Frozen Mountains on during their interrace brothers' war. They provided the primal clay that the Dwarves' king used to create his clay statues and the Colossus of Frozen Empire. After years of service
column2: dwarves' king found out that the dwarves were trading with his brother too they eventually rose against the king
column3: and for this
column4: they were slaughtered.

column1: Dwarves lived in the Frozen Empire mountains alongside several human barbarian tribes. The dwarves were hardy miners and doughty warriors inclined toward passionate
column2: explosive personalities. They exulted in battle
column3: favoring swarm tactics supplemented by fire magic and destruction of enemy resources. Some of these dwarves were enslaved by the ruler of the land.

column1: Dwarves live in the Frozen Empire mountains between Medieville and Misty Swamp. When other races settled on their land
column2: the dwarves journeyed south
column3: where they made an alliance with humans. This alliance led to tension between human and wizards when the amount of gold coming from the humans mines suddenly increased greatly thanks to dwarven technology.

column1: Shield dwarves
column2: are a subrace of dwarves
column3: survived a long fall from grace
column4: surrendering many of their ancient kingdoms in wars with goblins and orcs. These losses have lead to a cynical mindset
column5: yet shield dwarves will endure anything to restore their ancestral homelands.

column1: Dwarf wields a hammer because his father was a smith. And while that profession was not for him
column2: he still honors his family every time he goes to battle.

column1: Kingdoms rich in ancient grandeur
column2: halls carved into the roots of mountains
column3: the echoing of picks and hammers in deep mines and blazing forges
column4: a commitment to clan and tradition
column5: and a burning hatred of goblins and orcs these common threads unite all dwarves.

column1: The chief unit of dwarven society is the clan
column2: and dwarves highly value social standing. Even dwarves who live far from their own kingdoms cherish their clan identities and affiliations
column3: recognize related dwarves
column4: and invoke their ancestors' names in oaths and curses. To be clanless is the worst fate that can befall a dwarf.

column1: Dwarven kingdoms stretch deep beneath the mountains where the dwarves mine gems and precious metals and forge items of wonder. They love the beauty and artistry of precious metals and fine jewelry
column2: and in some dwarves this love festers into avarice. Whatever wealth they can't find in their mountains
column3: they gain through trade. They dislike boats
column4: so enterprising humans frequently handle trade in dwarven goods along water routes. Trustworthy members of other races are welcome in dwarf settlements
column5: though some areas are off limits even to them.

column1: ELF
Long ago the majestic high elves created the splendid golden city of Enchanted Forest
column2: built around a magical fount of energy known as the Enchanted Forest's energy. When the king destroyed their capital in the war
column3: the survivors turned to the horde for help. Now known as the blood elves
column4: these refugees are all that remains of their glorious civilization. They strive to rebuild Enchanted Forest while struggling against a crippling addiction to the very magical energies that once built their empire. For nearly seven thousand years
column5: the high elves cultivated a shining magical kingdom hidden deep within the forests of northern forest. But five years ago
column6: the undead evil invaded Enchanted Forest and drove the elves to the brink of extinction. Led by the evil death knight
column7: the evil destroyed the mystical city of Enchated Forest
column8: thereby severing the elves from the source of their arcane power. Though the scars of that conflict are evident
column9: the remaining elves have banded together and retaken much of their homeland. Calling themselves blood elves
column10: these grim survivors are committed to regaining the vast powers they once commanded. Inspired by the leadership of their beloved prince
column11: the blood elves now seek new sources of arcane magic and the means of defending their land against the undying horrors of the scourge. As one of the few surviving blood elves
column12: you must master your thirst for magic and help shape the destiny of your people. The past few years have seen unprecedented changes within the eternal land of the Enchanted Forest. The blood elves
column13: following the will of their crazed leader
column15: chaotic magicks to transform their sacred the Enchanted Forest into a gateway of unspeakable evil. While the evil and its demonic masters were eventually defeated
column16: a different transformation occurred within the Enchanted Forest itself as a dying elf sacrificed its life essence to reignite the Enchanted Forest as a font of holy energy. Now
column18: sees a new hope on the horizon for his people. Over time
column19: the Enchanted Forest's Light could cure the blood elves of their cursed state
column20: but many still cling to the arcane powers they procured and are hesitant to relinquish them. As one of the remaining blood elves
column21: you must fight to protect Enchanted Forest and help redeem the soul of your ancient people. Long ago the exiled high elves landed on the shores of Specular Waters. They struck out to find a new home
column22: and after many battles with the trolls
column23: established the kingdom of Enchanted Forest. Using a vial of sacred water stolen from the first well of eternity
column24: the high elves created a fount of mystical power at a convergence of ley energies in the Enchated Forest. They named this fountain the Enchanted Forest. Its potent arcane magic fed and strengthened the high elves
column25: and soon the wondrous city of Enchanted Forest was established.

column1: Protected by a magical barrier
column2: the high elves enjoyed peace for roughly four thousand years
column3: but that peace was not meant to last. The trolls gathered an immense army and assaulted the elven kingdom. Vastly outnumbered
column4: the high elves hastily struck an alliance with the human nation. The elves taught a small number of humans how to wield magic. In exchange the humans aided the elves in destroying the trolls' power base forever. Over the following years the high elves returned to their reclusive ways
column5: but during the war
column6: the diabolical prince brought battle once again to their doorstep. They required the power of the Enchanted Forest to revive the necromancer and raise him as a lich. He invaded the Enchanted Forest and wiped out most of its population.

column7: and took a group of the strongest fighters to join the campaign against the scourge.

column1: Enchanted Forest's culture placed great importance on the purity of the land. They had a brief era of prominence during the Dark.
The Enchanted Forest's elves lived on the highlands at the edges of the Sunny Valley. They could easily be mistaken for humans
column2: as they were very similar in appearance - lacking even pointed ears. It was said that this ancient race possibly had a common ancestor with humankind. The main characteristic setting the Enchanted Forest's elves apart from humans was their great natural beauty and their wide eyes whose irises changed color according to their mood. Enchanted Forest's elves were also very deadly warriors
